alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Walsenburg Vicinity, Upper Huerfano River Basin Below 7500 Ft; Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 11:56AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Huerfano County through 1230 PM MDT... At 1156 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gardner, or 8 miles north of Spring Burn Scar north of Highway 160, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northern Spring Burn Scar north of Highway 160, Gardner and Farisita. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
